had key tags that would basically tell
you know the room number the address and
all the information you needed so if you

it if you somehow forgot to bring it

basically have infinite access to that

there were a lot of problems with theft

and to address this tool came up with
the programmable key card the first one
was punch hole key card from that came
out in 1975 and it later evolved into
the magnet stripe card and then the RFID
type cards that we usually use today and
if we look at the patterns from the
original card it has a 32 possible hole
position set up they're always in the
same positions on all types of cards but
the combination makes them unique and
you can have 4.3 billion combinations
which was roughly equal to the number of
people living on earth at that time the
original design was fully mechanical so
you would program them by by having a
host card in the guest card and the
guest card would be the normal card and
then the host card would be inverse of
that card so you would put the host card
on the backside of the lock and then as
you came with the guest card and put
that in if they matched the door would
open it was a really really cool design
